actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide special annuities for certain employees separated from the service as a result of reduction in force actions, closing or transfer of bases and other organizational units, and abolishment of positions.

summary.text: Permits any Federal employee who is involuntarily separated from service as a result of a reduction in force, the abolishment of his position, the closing or transfer of any military or civilian base or other organizational unit of the Government, or any other organizational change defined by the Civil Service Commission, after completing 20 years of service, to in lieu of any annuity to which he is entitled, elect to receive an annuity equal to 66-2/3 percent of his average pay over any 3 consecutive years of creditable service. (Adds 5 U.S.C. 8336a)

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, United States Code, to provide special annuities for certain employees separated from the service as a result of reduction in force actions, closing or transfer of bases and other organizational units, and abolishment of positions.
